manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Paperback Audiobook eBook Different Versions for Different Needs The feel of real paper or a pretty to put on your self. Listen on the go! Keep it in your phone for random reading!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Magic, Humor & Begonias
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoyed the character development in this book. Jessie was a hoot! The minor characters were great, as well! There were a lot of great scenes and chemistry between them, which made the pages fly by!Niamh and her accurate rock throwing; Mr. Tom and his willingness to serve (when he and Niamh aren’t exchanging witty banter, that is!); Edgar dragging that body across the yard; and Austin, the alpha Jessie finds super attractive even if he is emotionally unavailable. This is a cast of unlikely characters all devoted to a common goal - helping Jessie unlock the magic of Ivy House, even despite creepy dolls, even despite her being a “Jane,” and all to embrace her fully for who she is, the life she has led, and the power and wit housed within her spirit!This book was full of humor, magic, a touch of romance, and it was such great fun! Not to mention begonias. Haha!I will definitely be reading Book 2!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A delightfully funny and sweet romp
reviews.reviewText: It’s not often that I find books that make me think about them outside of when I’m reading them, but this one was different. While divorced and “middle-aged” the heroine wasn’t a simpering dolt. The other main characters are funny, wacky, and weird as described. I can’t wait to start the next one!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars love for midlife!!
reviews.reviewText: Being well over 50 myself, I absolutely love the whole premise of this book and Jess finding her purpose after a divorce and grown child moving out! Can’t wait to start the next one. Very good book

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars loved every minute…
reviews.reviewText: Loved this book! It’s an easy read, the writing isn’t overdone, I was laughing through out, and the plot is great. I couldn’t put it down! I’ve always loved books of magic and fantasy but as I’m now in my early thirties the YA stuff just isn’t relatable anymore. It was nice to read a genre I love but with a more relatable MFC! Can’t wait to read the rest of this series!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Looking forward to next book. Sometimes you just need a little magic, and this fits the bill. Liked characters, and interested in the "House".

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Fun light read
reviews.reviewText: Book 1 of the series was a quick light hearted read. A few good funny lines sprinkled throughout. Characters with a good heart wrapped up in a magical bow. The writing is okay... not too distracting.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars good story but so much pandering
reviews.reviewText: I am pushing forty and a fantasy lover. I feel like this book was written for my demographic and while I liked the plot the writer really laid it on thick. The gross gladhanding for *~motherhood~*/ middle age and embracing yourself! As you are! Even with saggy tatas and wrinkles! Was pretty hard to swallow.Example: “The courage of a mother could not be measured. We toiled in the background, day in and day out, without thanks, so our children could become their best selves. We sacrificed ourselves for our loved ones, and we did it silently. Gladly. Full of love.”It would have feel more genuine if the main character didn’t decide at the end to “look just like I am” EXCEPT except except (except no stomach, perky tatas, no body aches etc) versus looking “younger”. What exactly stayed the same then? A few smile lines? Gross 🤮

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars cuteness in midlife
reviews.reviewText: Love reading a female centric, doesn’t need a hero, embracing the place in life where things sag, lose sparkle, but still have a snark to them storyline. This series is going to be fun.

reviews.reviewTitle: K.F. Breene never disappoints - even in re-reads
reviews.reviewText: This is the second (or is it third) time I'm reading the series. It is just as good as the first time.The story sets up the players and characters well. We learn a bit about each of them, and get to meet Ivy House.I ended up laughing out loud to myself while reading. Mr.Tom is a hoot.I'm super excited for my re-read of book 2-7. Book 8 is supposed to be on the way, and I'm stoked.If you enjoy books with humour, a bit of adventure, and a fmc learning some truths about herself - you'll probably enjoy this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It's often said that all the stories have already been told, and that all new stories are just rewrites of old inspiration... And sometimes that's true... But this one... Is awesomeThe magical midlife series paints femme bodies midlife as perfectly acceptable and a cause to celebrate oneselfIt shakes off the societal norm of lining for our younger selves and instead celebrates that life can still be what you make of it.Totally addicted to this series (this is my second read through ;). )

I love this author. She always makes me laugh and keeps me suspended through the book/series. I'm a little in love with Edgar and think he should have gotten more screen time. But that's just me.If you are under forty and can't relate to the main character, that's ok. Just read it again in a couple of years. If you are forty or beyond, go for it. It is a lot of fun.
J'adore cet auteur et elle ne m'a pas deçue dans ce premier tome riche rencontres et en aventures. Je me jette sur la .suite.

reviews.reviewTitle: Interesting PWF, although not my favourite of the genre
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed this book slightly less than I had expected. The humour wasn't quite mine, the repetition of "cracked up" referring to things or characters being a bit off was frustrating, and I never quite understood the reason for Jacinta being called Jessie. What set me off the most, however, was that, while the author did a great job at presenting a woman in her 40s as still in her prime and in many ways a more aware and rounded human being, she seemed to just move the definition of decrepit. She doesn't have the same respect and understanding for characters who originally appear to be in their 80s (of course we find out they are significantly older than that, but the impression by Jacinta is that). Of course, people start slowing down, falling apart physically and at times mentally, but it seemed hypocritical.That said, I enjoyed the secondary character. I enjoyed the idea of the house and the paranormal world. I liked the shifters being so varied. It was entertaining, and I will read the next book. But I do hope that some more understanding is provided to the older paranormals.
